Container.Name: HandBrake
Container.Overview:
HandBrake is a tool for converting video from nearly any format to a selection of modern, widely supported codecs.
The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client.
A fully automated mode is also available: drop files into a watch folder and let HandBrake process them without any user interaction.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small.
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake#readme

Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible to the application.

Config.Name: Watch Directory
Config.Description: This is the watch folder of the automatic video converter. Any video copied into this folder will be automatically converted by HandBrake.

Config.Name: Output Directory
Config.Description: This is the default output folder for converted videos. Also used by the automatic video converter.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Preset
Config.Description: Preset used by the automatic video converter. Identification of the preset must follow the format 'CATEGORY/PRESET NAME'. Name of all available presets can be seen via the HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Format
Config.Description: Video container format used by the automatic video converter for output files. This is typically the video filename extension.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Keep Source Files
Config.Description: Set to 0 to remove successfully converted videos from the watch folder, 1 to keep them.

Config.Name: Web Listening Port (Non-Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port used by the web server to serve the UI of the application. This port is used internally by the container and it is usually not required to be changed. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to something else than Bridge.

Config.Name: VNC Listening Port (Non-Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port used by the VNC server to serve the UI of the application. This port is used internally by the container and it is usually not required to be changed. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to something else than Bridge.

Config.Name: HandBrake GUI State
Config.Description: Setting this to 1 enables the HandBrake GUI, 0 disables it.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: State
Config.Description: Setting this to 1 enables the automatic video converter, 0 disables it.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Video File Extensions
Config.Description: Space-separated list of file extensions to be considered as video files. By default, this list is empty, meaning that the automatic video converter will let HandBrake automatically detects if a file, no matter its extension, is a video or not (note that extensions defined by the Non-Video File Extensions list are always considered as non-video files). Normally, this variable doesn't need to be set. Usage of this variable is useful when only specific video files need to converted.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Non-Video File Extensions
Config.Default: jpg jpeg bmp png gif txt nfo
Config.Description: Space-separated list of file extensions to be considered as not being videos. Most non-video files are properly rejected by HandBrake. However, some files, like images, are convertible by HandBrake even if they are not video files.

Container.Config: jpg jpeg bmp png gif txt nfo

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Overwrite Destination
Config.Description: Setting this to 1 allows the final destination file to be overwritten if it already exists.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Source File Stable Time
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of a video file in the watch folder need to remain the same. This is to avoid processing a file that is being copied.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Minimum Title Duration
Config.Description: Minimum title duration (in seconds). Shorter titles will be ignored. This applies only to video disc sources (ISO file, VIDEO_TS folder or BDMV folder).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Main Title Detection
Config.Description: Setting this to 1 enables HandBrake main feature title detection to try to guess and select the main title.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Check Interval
Config.Description: Interval (in seconds) at which the automatic video converter checks for new files.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Number of Watch Folders
Config.Description: Maximum number of watch folders handled by the automatic video converter.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Disable Progress in GUI
Config.Description: Set to 1 to disable display of the video conversion progress in HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Custom HandBrake Arguments
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to HandBrake when performing a conversion.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Install Packages
Config.Description: Space-separated list of Alpine Linux packages to install. This is useful when the automatic video converter's hooks require tools not available in the container image. See https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org for the list of available Alpine Linux packages.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Use Trash Directory
Config.Description: Set to 1 to enable usage of the trash directory. So when the automatic video converter is configured to not keep sources, it will move files to the trash directory (/trash inside the container) instead of deleting them.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI (Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port to access the application's GUI via the web interface. NOTE: This applies only when Network Type is set to Bridge.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI (Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port to access the application's GUI via VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used. NOTE: This applies only when Network Type is set to Bridge.
